title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Milk Agency (Conduct
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the National Milk Agency (Conduct 

of Elections) (Amendment No. 2) Regulations 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited national milk agency (conduct elections) (amendment no 2) regulation 2021

title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: 2. The National Milk Agency (Conduct of Elections) Regulations 1997 (S.
text_raw:
2. The National Milk Agency (Conduct of Elections) Regulations 1997 (S. 

I. No. 185 of 1997) are amended by: 

(a) 

(b) 

the amendment of Regulation 8 by 
“nominations” for “nomination papers”; 

the substitution of 

the amendment of Regulation 9 by the substitution of the number 
“6” for the number “15”; 

(c) 

the substitution for Regulation 14(4) of the following:- 

“14(4) Nominations shall be in such form or forms whether 
electronic or otherwise and include such particulars as may be 
specified by the returning officer, and each candidate shall be 
nominated separately. Nominations for candidates may consist 
of several forms or communications and may be made by postal 
or electronic communication or otherwise as may be specified by 
the returning officer.”; 

(d) 

the amendment of Regulation 16(1) by the substitution of 
“nominations” for “completed nomination papers”; 

(e) 

the substitution for Regulation 16(2) of the following:- 

shall 

“16 (2) Nominations 
otherwise 
be 
communicated to the office of the Agency within the time and by 
such means as shall be specified by the returning officer in the 
Notice of Election.”; 

delivered 

or 

(f) 

the substitution of Regulation 17(1) by the following:- 

“17 (1) At an election the returning officer shall record the order 
in which the nominations are received by him and he shall rule on 
the validity of such nominations in the order in which he received 
them.”; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 23rd July, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [372] 3 

(g) 

the amendment of Regulation 17(2) by the deletion of the word 
“paper”; 

(h) 

the substitution of Regulation 17(3) by the following:- 

“When the returning officer has ruled on the validation of a 
nomination he shall make a note of his decision. If he rules the 
nomination is invalid he shall include in such note a statement of 
the reasons for his decision.”; 

(i) 

(j) 

the amendment of Regulation 17(4) by the deletion of the word 
“paper”; 

the amendment of Regulation 18 by the deletion of the words 
“and the names of the registered producers by which the persons 
nominated as candidates were proposed”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

13 July, 2021. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [372]

title: paragraph 5(5) (as amended by section 4 of the Milk (Regulation of Supply)
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to amend the provision for nomination of 
candidates for the election of producer representatives to the National Milk 
Agency. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [372] 5
